entry.title: Awesome Go Updates on Apr 05, 2022
entry.content:
Bit-packing and Compression

  • crunch (‚≠ê100) - Go package implementing buffers for handling various datatypes easily.
  • go-ef (‚≠ê39) - A Go implementation of the Elias-Fano encoding.
  • roaring (‚≠ê2.7k) - Go package implementing compressed bitsets.

Bloom and Cuckoo Filters

  • cuckoofilter (‚≠ê1.2k) - Cuckoo filter: a good alternative to a counting bloom filter implemented in Go.
  • ring (‚≠ê141) - Go implementation of a high performance, thread safe bloom filter.

Data Structure and Algorithm Collections

  • algorithms (‚≠ê821) - Algorithms and data structures.CLRS study.
  • go-datastructures (‚≠ê7.8k) - Collection of useful, performant, and thread-safe data structures.
  • gods (‚≠ê17k) - Go Data Structures. Containers, Sets, Lists, Stacks, Maps, BidiMaps, Trees, HashSet etc.
  • gostl (‚≠ê1.1k) - Data structure and algorithm library for go, designed to provide functions similar to C++ STL.

Iterators

  • goterator (‚≠ê17) - Iterator implementation to provide map and reduce functionalities.
  • iter (‚≠ê191) - Go implementation of C++ STL iterators and algorithms.

Maps

  • dict (‚≠ê47) - Python-like dictionaries (dict) for Go.

Nullable Types

  • nan (‚≠ê87) - Zero allocation Nullable structures in one library with handy conversion functions, marshallers and unmarshallers.
  • null (‚≠ê38) - Nullable Go types that can be marshalled/unmarshalled to/from JSON.
  • typ (‚≠ê46) - Null Types, Safe primitive type conversion and fetching value from complex structures.

Queues

  • deque (‚≠ê200) - A highly optimized double-ended queue.
  • deque (‚≠ê690) - Fast ring-buffer deque (double-ended queue).
  • goconcurrentqueue (‚≠ê427) - Concurrent FIFO queue.
  • memlog (‚≠ê133) - An easy to use, lightweight, thread-safe and append-only in-memory data structure inspired by Apache Kafka.

Sets

  • dsu (‚≠ê15) - Disjoint Set data structure implementation in Go.
  • golang-set (‚≠ê4.5k) - Thread-Safe and Non-Thread-Safe high-performance sets for Go.
  • goset (‚≠ê52) - A useful Set collection implementation for Go.
  • set (‚≠ê29) - Simple set data structure implementation in Go using LinkedHashMap.

Text Analysis

  • bleve (‚≠ê10k) - Modern text indexing library for go.
  • go-adaptive-radix-tree (‚≠ê392) - Go implementation of Adaptive Radix Tree.
  • go-edlib (‚≠ê517) - Go string comparison and edit distance algorithms library (Levenshtein, LCS, Hamming, Damerau levenshtein, Jaro-Winkler, etc.) compatible with Unicode.
  • trie (‚≠ê776) - Trie implementation in Go.

Trees

  • hashsplit (‚≠ê31) - Split byte streams into chunks, and arrange chunks into trees, with boundaries determined by content, not position.
  • merkle (‚≠ê19) - Space-efficient computation of Merkle root hashes and inclusion proofs.

Pipes

  • ordered-concurrently (‚≠ê41) - Go module that processes work concurrently and returns output in a channel in the order of input.
  • parapipe (‚≠ê37) - FIFO Pipeline which parallels execution on each stage while maintaining the order of messages and results.
  • pipeline (‚≠ê58) - An implementation of pipelines with fan-in and fan-out.

Caches

  • 2q (‚≠ê47) - 2Q in-memory cache implementation.
  • couchcache (‚≠ê67) - RESTful caching micro-service backed by Couchbase server.
  • fastcache (‚≠ê2.2k) - fast thread-safe inmemory cache for big number of entries. Minimizes GC overhead.
  • GCache (‚≠ê2.7k) - Cache library with support for expirable Cache, LFU, LRU and ARC.
  • gdcache (‚≠ê13) - A pure non-intrusive cache library implemented by golang, you can use it to implement your own distributed cache.
  • go-mcache (‚≠ê98) - Fast in-memory key:value store/cache library. Pointer caches.
  • groupcache (‚≠ê13k) - Groupcache is a caching and cache-filling library, intended as a replacement for memcached in many cases.
  • timedmap (‚≠ê75) - Map with expiring key-value pairs.
  • ttlcache (‚≠ê1.1k) - An in-memory cache with item expiration and generics.
  • ttlcache (‚≠ê10) - In-memory key value storage with TTL for each record.

Databases Implemented in Go

  • badger (‚≠ê15k) - Fast key-value store in Go.
  • bbolt (‚≠ê8.9k) - An embedded key/value database for Go.
  • Bitcask - Bitcask is an embeddable, persistent and fast key-value (KV) database written in pure Go with predictable read/write performance, low latency and high throughput thanks to the bitcask on-disk layout (LSM+WAL).
  • buntdb (‚≠ê4.7k) - Fast, embeddable, in-memory key/value database for Go with custom indexing and spatial support.
  • clover (‚≠ê760) - A lightweight document-oriented NoSQL database written in pure Golang.
  • pudge (‚≠ê373) - Fast and simple key/value store written using Go's standard library.

Database Tools

  • clickhouse-bulk (‚≠ê498) - Collects small inserts and sends big requests to ClickHouse servers.

Interfaces to Multiple Backends

  • cayley (‚≠ê15k) - Graph database with support for multiple backends.
  • dsc (‚≠ê34) - Datastore connectivity for SQL, NoSQL, structured files.
  • gokv (‚≠ê801) - Simple key-value store abstraction and implementations for Go (Redis, Consul, etcd, bbolt, BadgerDB, LevelDB, Memcached, DynamoDB, S3, PostgreSQL, MongoDB, CockroachDB and many more).

Relational Database Drivers

  • avatica (‚≠ê122) - Apache Avatica/Phoenix SQL driver for database/sql.
  • bgc (‚≠ê21) - Datastore Connectivity for BigQuery for go.
  • firebirdsql (‚≠ê243) - Firebird RDBMS SQL driver for Go.
  • go-adodb (‚≠ê148) - Microsoft ActiveX Object DataBase driver for go that uses database/sql.
  • go-mssqldb (‚≠ê1.9k) - Microsoft MSSQL driver for Go.
  • go-oci8 (‚≠ê634) - Oracle driver for go that uses database/sql.
  • go-sql-driver/mysql (‚≠ê15k) - MySQL driver for Go.
  • go-sqlite3 (‚≠ê8.6k) - SQLite3 driver for go that uses database/sql.
  • godror (‚≠ê559) - Oracle driver for Go, using the ODPI-C driver.
  • gofreetds (‚≠ê113) - Microsoft MSSQL driver. Go wrapper over FreeTDS.
  • pgx (‚≠ê12k) - PostgreSQL driver supporting features beyond those exposed by database/sql.
  • pig (‚≠ê17) - Simple pgx (‚≠ê12k) wrapper to execute and scan (‚≠ê1.4k) query results easily.
  • pq (‚≠ê9.5k) - Pure Go Postgres driver for database/sql.
  • Sqinn-Go (‚≠ê450) - SQLite with pure Go.
  • sqlhooks (‚≠ê656) - Attach hooks to any database/sql driver.

NoSQL Database Drivers

  • aerospike-client-go (‚≠ê450) - Aerospike client in Go language.
  • arangolite (‚≠ê72) - Lightweight golang driver for ArangoDB.
  • asc (‚≠ê11) - Datastore Connectivity for Aerospike for go.
  • forestdb (‚≠ê36) - Go bindings for ForestDB.
  • go-couchbase (‚≠ê323) - Couchbase client in Go.
  • go-pilosa (‚≠ê57) - Go client library for Pilosa.
  • go-rejson (‚≠ê343) - Golang client for redislabs' ReJSON module using Redigo golang client. Store and manipulate structs as JSON objects in redis with ease.
  • gocb (‚≠ê373) - Official Couchbase Go SDK.
  • gocosmos (‚≠ê22) - REST client and standard database/sql driver for Azure Cosmos DB.
  • gocql - Go language driver for Apache Cassandra.
  • godis (‚≠ê113) - redis client implement by golang, inspired by jedis.
  • godscache (‚≠ê11) - A wrapper for the Google Cloud Platform Go Datastore package that adds caching using memcached.
  • gomemcache (‚≠ê1.8k) - memcache client library for the Go programming language.
  • gorethink (‚≠ê1.7k) - Go language driver for RethinkDB.
  • goriak (‚≠ê30) - Go language driver for Riak KV.
  • neo4j (‚≠ê29) - Neo4j Rest API Bindings for Golang.
  • neoism (‚≠ê390) - Neo4j client for Golang.
  • qmgo (‚≠ê1.3k) - The MongoDB driver for Go. It‚Äòs based on official MongoDB driver but easier to use like Mgo.
  • redeo (‚≠ê445) - Redis-protocol compatible TCP servers/services.
  • redigo (‚≠ê9.8k) - Redigo is a Go client for the Redis database.
  • rueidis (‚≠ê2.7k) - Fast Redis RESP3 client with auto pipelining and server-assisted client side caching.
  • xredis (‚≠ê19) - Typesafe, customizable, clean & easy to use Redis client.

Search and Analytic Databases

  • elastic (‚≠ê7.5k) - Elasticsearch client for Go.
  • elasticsql (‚≠ê1.2k) - Convert sql to elasticsearch dsl in Go.
  • elastigo (‚≠ê942) - Elasticsearch client library.
  • go-elasticsearch (‚≠ê5.9k) - Official Elasticsearch client for Go.
  • goes (‚≠ê31) - Library to interact with Elasticsearch.
  • skizze (‚≠ê92) - probabilistic data-structures service and storage.

entry.content:
Language Detection

  • guesslanguage (‚≠ê58) - Functions to determine the natural language of a unicode text.
  • whatlanggo (‚≠ê659) - Natural language detection package for Go. Supports 84 languages and 24 scripts (writing systems e.g. Latin, Cyrillic, etc).

Morphological Analyzers

  • snowball (‚≠ê38) - Snowball stemmer port (cgo wrapper) for Go. Provides word stem extraction functionality Snowball native.
  • spaGO (‚≠ê1.8k) - Self-contained Machine Learning and Natural Language Processing library in Go.

Slugifiers

  • go-slugify (‚≠ê95) - Make pretty slug with multiple languages support.
  • slug (‚≠ê1.3k) - URL-friendly slugify with multiple languages support.
  • Slugify (‚≠ê34) - Go slugify application that handles string.

Tokenizers

  • gojieba (‚≠ê2.5k) - This is a Go implementation of jieba (‚≠ê34k) which a Chinese word splitting algorithm.
  • gotokenizer (‚≠ê21) - A tokenizer based on the dictionary and Bigram language models for Golang. (Now only support chinese segmentation)
  • gse (‚≠ê2.7k) - Go efficient text segmentation; support english, chinese, japanese and other.
  • MMSEGO (‚≠ê62) - This is a GO implementation of MMSEG which a Chinese word splitting algorithm.
  • prose (‚≠ê3.1k) - Library for text processing that supports tokenization, part-of-speech tagging, named-entity extraction, and more. English only.

Translation

  • go-i18n (‚≠ê3.3k) - Package and an accompanying tool to work with localized text.
  • go-mystem (‚≠ê34) - CGo bindings to Yandex.Mystem - russian morphology analyzer.
  • go-pinyin (‚≠ê1.7k) - CN Hanzi to Hanyu Pinyin converter.
  • gotext (‚≠ê473) - GNU gettext utilities for Go.
  • iuliia-go (‚≠ê53) - Transliterate Cyrillic ‚Üí Latin in every possible way.
  • t (‚≠ê20) - Another i18n pkg for golang, which follows GNU gettext style and supports .po/.mo files: t.T (gettext), t.N (ngettext), etc. And it contains a cmd tool xtemplate (‚≠ê20), which can extract messages as a pot file from text/html template.

Transliteration

  • enca (‚≠ê18) - Minimal cgo bindings for libenca, which detects character encodings.
  • go-unidecode (‚≠ê141) - ASCII transliterations of Unicode text.
  • gounidecode (‚≠ê80) - Unicode transliterator (also known as unidecode) for Go.

Formatters

  • address (‚≠ê77) - Handles address representation, validation and formatting.
  • align (‚≠ê84) - A general purpose application that aligns text.
  • bytes (‚≠ê553) - Formats and parses numeric byte values (10K, 2M, 3G, etc.).
  • go-fixedwidth (‚≠ê86) - Fixed-width text formatting (encoder/decoder with reflection).
  • go-humanize (‚≠ê4.6k) - Formatters for time, numbers, and memory size to human readable format.
  • gotabulate (‚≠ê337) - Easily pretty-print your tabular data with Go.
  • textwrap (‚≠ê5) - Wraps text at end of lines. Implementation of textwrap module from Python.

Markup Languages

  • bafi (‚≠ê107) - Universal JSON, BSON, YAML, XML translator to ANY format using templates.
  • bbConvert (‚≠ê12) - Converts bbCode to HTML that allows you to add support for custom bbCode tags.
  • blackfriday (‚≠ê5.6k) - Markdown processor in Go.
  • go-output-format (‚≠ê18) - Output go structures into multiple formats (YAML/JSON/etc) in your command line app.
  • go-toml (‚≠ê1.8k) - Go library for the TOML format with query support and handy cli tools.
  • html-to-markdown (‚≠ê2.9k) - Convert HTML to Markdown. Even works with entire websites and can be extended through rules.
  • htmlquery (‚≠ê769) - An XPath query package for HTML, lets you extract data or evaluate from HTML documents by an XPath expression.
  • mxj (‚≠ê627) - Encode / decode XML as JSON or map[string]interface{}; extract values with dot-notation paths and wildcards. Replaces x2j and j2x packages.
  • toml (‚≠ê4.8k) - TOML configuration format (encoder/decoder with reflection).

Parsers/Encoders/Decoders

  • allot (‚≠ê59) - Placeholder and wildcard text parsing for CLI tools and bots.
  • codetree (‚≠ê25) - Parses indented code (python, pixy, scarlet, etc.) and returns a tree structure.

Regular Expressions

Sanitation

Scrapers

  • xurls (‚≠ê1.2k) - Extract urls from text.

RSS

Utility/Miscellaneous

  • petrovich (‚≠ê50) - Petrovich is the library which inflects Russian names to given grammatical case.
  • radix (‚≠ê193) - Fast string sorting algorithm.
  • TySug (‚≠ê19) - Alternative suggestions with respect to keyboard layouts.

entry.title: Awesome Go Updates on Feb 04, 2022
entry.content:
Audio and Music

  • flac (‚≠ê336) - Native Go FLAC encoder/decoder with support for FLAC streams.
  • gaad (‚≠ê131) - Native Go AAC bitstream parser.
  • GoAudio (‚≠ê377) - Native Go Audio Processing Library.
  • gosamplerate (‚≠ê36) - libsamplerate bindings for go.
  • id3v2 (‚≠ê348) - ID3 decoding and encoding library for Go.
  • malgo (‚≠ê341) - Mini audio library.
  • minimp3 (‚≠ê129) - Lightweight MP3 decoder library.
  • Oto (‚≠ê1.7k) - A low-level library to play sound on multiple platforms.
  • PortAudio (‚≠ê778) - Go bindings for the PortAudio audio I/O library.

Authentication and OAuth

  • branca (‚≠ê90) - branca token specification implementation (‚≠ê230) for Golang 1.15+.
  • gologin (‚≠ê1.9k) - chainable handlers for login with OAuth1 and OAuth2 authentication providers.
  • gorbac (‚≠ê1.6k) - provides a lightweight role-based access control (RBAC) implementation in Golang.
  • goth (‚≠ê6.1k) - provides a simple, clean, and idiomatic way to use OAuth and OAuth2. Handles multiple providers out of the box.
  • jwt (‚≠ê363) - Lightweight JSON Web Token (JWT) library.
  • jwt-auth (‚≠ê234) - JWT middleware for Golang http servers with many configuration options.
  • osin (‚≠ê1.9k) - Golang OAuth2 server library.
  • otpgen (‚≠ê140) - Library to generate TOTP/HOTP codes.
  • otpgo (‚≠ê75) - Time-Based One-Time Password (TOTP) and HMAC-Based One-Time Password (HOTP) library for Go.
  • paseto (‚≠ê900) - Golang implementation of Platform-Agnostic Security Tokens (PASETO).
  • scope (‚≠ê41) - Easily Manage OAuth2 Scopes In Go.
  • scs (‚≠ê2.4k) - Session Manager for HTTP servers.
  • securecookie (‚≠ê81) - Efficient secure cookie encoding/decoding.
  • session (‚≠ê118) - Go session management for web servers (including support for Google App Engine - GAE).
  • sessions (‚≠ê78) - Dead simple, highly performant, highly customizable sessions service for go http servers.
  • sessionup (‚≠ê128) - Simple, yet effective HTTP session management and identification package.
  • sjwt (‚≠ê123) - Simple jwt generator and parser.

Blockchain

  • cosmos-sdk (‚≠ê6.6k) - A Framework for Building Public Blockchains in the Cosmos Ecosystem.
  • go-ethereum (‚≠ê49k) - Official Go implementation of the Ethereum protocol.
  • gossamer (‚≠ê451) - A Go implementation of the Polkadot Host.
  • solana-go (‚≠ê1.3k) - Go library to interface with Solana JSON RPC and WebSocket interfaces.
  • tendermint (‚≠ê5.8k) - High-performance middleware for transforming a state machine written in any programming language into a Byzantine Fault Tolerant replicated state machine using the Tendermint consensus and blockchain protocols.

Bot Building

  • echotron (‚≠ê405) - An elegant and concurrent library for Telegram Bots in Go.
  • go-joe - A general-purpose bot library inspired by Hubot but written in Go.
  • go-twitch-irc (‚≠ê377) - Library to write bots for twitch.tv chat
  • micha (‚≠ê30) - Go Library for Telegram bot api.
  • slack-bot (‚≠ê198) - Ready to use Slack Bot for lazy developers: Custom commands, Jenkins, Jira, Bitbucket, Github...
  • telego (‚≠ê734) - Telegram Bot API library for Golang with full one-to-one API implementation.

Build Automation

  • 1build (‚≠ê233) - Command line tool to frictionlessly manage project-specific commands.
  • anko (‚≠ê41) - Simple application watcher for multiple programming languages.
  • gilbert - Build system and task runner for Go projects.
  • goyek (‚≠ê629) - Create build pipelines in Go.
  • mage (‚≠ê4.4k) - Mage is a make/rake-like build tool using Go.
  • mmake (‚≠ê1.7k) - Modern Make.
  • Task (‚≠ê13k) - simple "Make" alternative.
  • taskctl (‚≠ê312) - Concurrent task runner.

Advanced Console UIs

  • asciigraph (‚≠ê2.8k) - Go package to make lightweight ASCII line graph ‚ï≠‚îà‚ïØ in command line apps with no other dependencies.
  • box-cli-maker (‚≠ê565) - Make Highly Customized Boxes for your CLI.
  • cfmt (‚≠ê106) - Contextual fmt inspired by bootstrap color classes.
  • cfmt (‚≠ê70) - Simple and convenient formatted stylized output fully compatible with fmt library.
  • chalk (‚≠ê465) - Intuitive package for prettifying terminal/console output.
  • ctc (‚≠ê50) - The non-invasive cross-platform terminal color library does not need to modify the Print method.
  • go-ataman (‚≠ê19) - Go library for rendering ANSI colored text templates in terminals.
  • go-colorable (‚≠ê793) - Colorable writer for windows.
  • go-colortext (‚≠ê216) - Go library for color output in terminals.
  • go-isatty (‚≠ê864) - isatty for golang.
  • go-prompt (‚≠ê5.4k) - Library for building a powerful interactive prompt, inspired by python-prompt-toolkit (‚≠ê9.8k).
  • gocui (‚≠ê10k) - Minimalist Go library aimed at creating Console User Interfaces.
  • gommon/color (‚≠ê553) - Style terminal text.
  • gookit/color (‚≠ê1.5k) - Terminal color rendering tool library, support 16 colors, 256 colors, RGB color rendering output, compatible with Windows.
  • marker (‚≠ê51) - Easiest way to match and mark strings for colorful terminal outputs.
  • mpb (‚≠ê2.4k) - Multi progress bar for terminal applications.
  • progressbar (‚≠ê4.4k) - Basic thread-safe progress bar that works in every OS.
  • pterm (‚≠ê5.1k) - A library to beautify console output on every platform with many combinable components.
  • spinner (‚≠ê2.4k) - Go package to easily provide a terminal spinner with options.
  • tabby (‚≠ê358) - A tiny library for super simple Golang tables.
  • termbox-go (‚≠ê4.7k) - Termbox is a library for creating cross-platform text-based interfaces.
  • termdash (‚≠ê2.8k) - Go terminal dashboard based on termbox-go and inspired by termui (‚≠ê13k).
  • termenv (‚≠ê1.9k) - Advanced ANSI style & color support for your terminal applications.
  • termui (‚≠ê13k) - Go terminal dashboard based on termbox-go and inspired by blessed-contrib (‚≠ê16k).
  • uiprogress (‚≠ê2.1k) - Flexible library to render progress bars in terminal applications.
  • uitable (‚≠ê741) - Library to improve readability in terminal apps using tabular data.
  • yacspin (‚≠ê449) - Yet Another CLi Spinner package, for working with terminal spinners.

Standard CLI

  • argparse (‚≠ê623) - Command line argument parser inspired by Python's argparse module.
  • argv (‚≠ê41) - Go library to split command line string as arguments array using the bash syntax.
  • climax (‚≠ê219) - Alternative CLI with "human face", in spirit of Go command.
  • cl√Ær (‚≠ê193) - A Simple and Clear CLI library. Dependency free.
  • cmd (‚≠ê43) - Extends the standard flag package to support sub commands and more in idiomatic way.
  • cmdr (‚≠ê140) - A POSIX/GNU style, getopt-like command-line UI Go library.
  • cobra (‚≠ê41k) - Commander for modern Go CLI interactions.
  • commandeer (‚≠ê176) - Dev-friendly CLI apps: sets up flags, defaults, and usage based on struct fields and tags.
  • complete (‚≠ê939) - Write bash completions in Go + Go command bash completion.
  • Dnote (‚≠ê2.9k) - A simple command line notebook with multi-device sync.
  • elvish (‚≠ê6.1k) - An expressive programming language and a versatile interactive shell.
  • env (‚≠ê121) - Tag-based environment configuration for structs.
  • flaggy (‚≠ê862) - A robust and idiomatic flags package with excellent subcommand support.
  • flagvar (‚≠ê45) - A collection of flag argument types for Go's standard flag package.
  • go-arg (‚≠ê2.2k) - Struct-based argument parsing in Go.
  • go-flags (‚≠ê2.7k) - go command line option parser.
  • gocmd (‚≠ê66) - Go library for building command line applications.
  • hiboot cli (‚≠ê181) - cli application framework with auto configuration and dependency injection.
  • job (‚≠ê148) - JOB, make your short-term command as a long-term job.
  • kingpin (‚≠ê3.5k) - Command line and flag parser supporting sub commands (superseded by kong; see below).
  • liner (‚≠ê1.1k) - Go readline-like library for command-line interfaces.
  • mow.cli (‚≠ê886) - Go library for building CLI applications with sophisticated flag and argument parsing and validation.
  • ops (‚≠ê1.4k) - Unikernel Builder/Orchestrator.
  • pflag (‚≠ê2.6k) - Drop-in replacement for Go's flag package, implementing POSIX/GNU-style --flags.
  • sand (‚≠ê27) - Simple API for creating interpreters and so much more.
  • strumt (‚≠ê62) - Library to create prompt chain.
  • subcmd (‚≠ê8) - Another approach to parsing and running subcommands. Works alongside the standard flag package.
  • ts (‚≠ê21) - Timestamp convert & compare tool.
  • ukautz/clif (‚≠ê129) - Small command line interface framework.
  • urfave/cli (‚≠ê23k) - Simple, fast, and fun package for building command line apps in Go (formerly codegangsta/cli).
  • wlog (‚≠ê67) - Simple logging interface that supports cross-platform color and concurrency.

Configuration

  • aconfig (‚≠ê594) - Simple, useful and opinionated config loader.
  • cleanenv (‚≠ê1.9k) - Minimalistic configuration reader (from files, ENV, and wherever you want).
  • config (‚≠ê337) - Cloud native application configuration. Bind ENV to structs in only two lines.
  • configuration (‚≠ê108) - Library for initializing configuration structs from env variables, files, flags and 'default' tag.
  • configure (‚≠ê55) - Provides configuration through multiple sources, including JSON, flags and environment variables.
  • configuro (‚≠ê94) - opinionated configuration loading & validation framework from ENV and Files focused towards 12-Factor compliant applications.
  • confita (‚≠ê505) - Load configuration in cascade from multiple backends into a struct.
  • conflate (‚≠ê36) - Library/tool to merge multiple JSON/YAML/TOML files from arbitrary URLs, validation against a JSON schema, and application of default values defined in the schema.
  • env (‚≠ê5.6k) - Parse environment variables to Go structs (with defaults).
  • env (‚≠ê70) - A lightweight package for loading environment variables into structs.
  • envconfig (‚≠ê244) - Read your configuration from environment variables.
  • envh (‚≠ê100) - Helpers to manage environment variables.
  • fig (‚≠ê381) - Tiny library for reading configuration from a file and from environment variables (with validation & defaults).
  • genv (‚≠ê42) - Read environment variables easily with dotenv support.
  • go-aws-ssm (‚≠ê62) - Go package that fetches parameters from AWS System Manager - Parameter Store.
  • go-conf (‚≠ê11) - Simple library for application configuration based on annotated structs. It supports reading the configuration from environment variables, config files and command line parameters.
  • go-ini (‚≠ê15) - A Go package that marshals and unmarshals INI-files.
  • go-ssm-config (‚≠ê22) - Go utility for loading configuration parameters from AWS SSM (Parameter Store).
  • go-up (‚≠ê43) - A simple configuration library with recursive placeholders resolution and no magic.
  • godotenv (‚≠ê9.5k) - Go port of Ruby's dotenv library (Loads environment variables from .env).
  • gofigure (‚≠ê68) - Go application configuration made easy.
  • gonfig (‚≠ê9) - Tag-based configuration parser which loads values from different providers into typesafe struct.
  • gookit/config (‚≠ê558) - application config manage(load,get,set). support JSON, YAML, TOML, INI, HCL. multi file load, data override merge.
  • hjson (‚≠ê336) - Human JSON, a configuration file format for humans. Relaxed syntax, fewer mistakes, more comments.
  • hocon (‚≠ê85) - Configuration library for working with the HOCON(a human-friendly JSON superset) format, supports features like environment variables, referencing other values, comments and multiple files.
  • ingo (‚≠ê40) - Flags persisted in an ini-like config file.
  • ini (‚≠ê3.5k) - Go package to read and write INI files.
  • joshbetz/config (‚≠ê215) - Small configuration library for Go that parses environment variables, JSON files, and reloads automatically on SIGHUP.
  • kelseyhightower/envconfig (‚≠ê5.3k) - Go library for managing configuration data from environment variables.
  • koanf (‚≠ê3.3k) - Light weight, extensible library for reading config in Go applications. Built in support for JSON, TOML, YAML, env, command line.
  • konfig (‚≠ê645) - Composable, observable and performant config handling for Go for the distributed processing era.
  • mini (‚≠ê37) - Golang package for parsing ini-style configuration files.
  • nasermirzaei89/env (‚≠ê18) - Simple useful package for read environment variables.
  • onion (‚≠ê118) - Layer based configuration for Go, Supports JSON, TOML, YAML, properties, etcd, env, and encryption using PGP.
  • piper (‚≠ê10) - Viper wrapper with config inheritance and key generation.
  • store (‚≠ê275) - Lightweight configuration manager for Go.
  • swap (‚≠ê8) - Instantiate/configure structs recursively, based on build environment. (YAML, TOML, JSON and env).
  • typenv (‚≠ê12) - Minimalistic, zero dependency, typed environment variables library.
  • uConfig (‚≠ê72) - Lightweight, zero-dependency, and extendable configuration management.
  • viper (‚≠ê29k) - Go configuration with fangs.

Continuous Integration

  • CDS (‚≠ê4.7k) - Enterprise-Grade CI/CD and DevOps Automation Open Source Platform.
  • drone (‚≠ê33k) - Drone is a Continuous Integration platform built on Docker, written in Go.
  • gomason (‚≠ê65) - Test, Build, Sign, and Publish your go binaries from a clean workspace.
  • goveralls (‚≠ê790) - Go integration for Coveralls.io continuous code coverage tracking system.
  • overalls (‚≠ê115) - Multi-Package go project coverprofile for tools like goveralls.
  • roveralls (‚≠ê20) - Recursive coverage testing tool.

CSS Preprocessors

  • go-libsass (‚≠ê212) - Go wrapper to the 100% Sass compatible libsass project.

Bit-packing and Compression

  • bingo (‚≠ê45) - Fast, zero-allocation, lexicographical-order-preserving packing of native types to bytes.
  • binpacker (‚≠ê231) - Binary packer and unpacker helps user build custom binary stream.
  • bit (‚≠ê163) - Golang set data structure with bonus bit-twiddling functions.

Bit Sets

  • bitmap (‚≠ê341) - Dense, zero-allocation, SIMD-enabled bitmap/bitset in Go.

Bloom and Cuckoo Filters

  • bloom (‚≠ê147) - Bloom filters implemented in Go.
  • bloom (‚≠ê87) - Golang Bloom filter implementation.
  • bloomfilter (‚≠ê18) - Yet another Bloomfilter implementation in Go, compatible with Java's Guava library.
  • boomfilters (‚≠ê1.6k) - Probabilistic data structures for processing continuous, unbounded streams.

Maps

  • cmap (‚≠ê96) - a thread-safe concurrent map for go, support using interface{} as key and auto scale up shards.

Miscellaneous Data Structures and Algorithms

  • concurrent-writer (‚≠ê57) - Highly concurrent drop-in replacement for bufio.Writer.
  • count-min-log (‚≠ê67) - Go implementation Count-Min-Log sketch: Approximately counting with approximate counters (Like Count-Min sketch but using less memory).
  • fsm (‚≠ê80) - Finite-State Machine package.
  • go-geoindex (‚≠ê358) - In-memory geo index.
  • go-rquad (‚≠ê137) - Region quadtrees with efficient point location and neighbour finding.
  • gofal (‚≠ê19) - fractional api for Go.
  • gota (‚≠ê3.2k) - Implementation of dataframes, series, and data wrangling methods for Go.
  • hide (‚≠ê70) - ID type with marshalling to/from hash to prevent sending IDs to clients.
  • hyperloglog (‚≠ê985) - HyperLogLog implementation with Sparse, LogLog-Beta bias correction and TailCut space reduction.

Text Analysis

  • levenshtein (‚≠ê88) - Levenshtein distance and similarity metrics with customizable edit costs and Winkler-like bonus for common prefix.
  • levenshtein (‚≠ê421) - Implementation to calculate levenshtein distance in Go.
  • mspm (‚≠ê26) - Multi-String Pattern Matching Algorithm for information retrieval.
  • parsefields (‚≠ê7) - Tools for parse JSON-like logs for collecting unique fields and events.
  • ptrie (‚≠ê43) - An implementation of prefix tree.

Trees

  • skiplist (‚≠ê286) - Very fast Go Skiplist implementation.
  • skiplist (‚≠ê84) - Skiplist implementation in Go.
  • treap - Persistent, fast ordered map using tree heaps.

Caches

  • BigCache (‚≠ê7.9k) - Efficient key/value cache for gigabytes of data.
  • cache (‚≠ê193) - In-memory key:value store with expiration time, 0 dependencies, <100 LoC, 100% coverage.
  • cache2go (‚≠ê2.2k) - In-memory key:value cache which supports automatic invalidation based on timeouts.
  • clusteredBigCache (‚≠ê45) - BigCache with clustering support and individual item expiration.

Databases Implemented in Go

  • cockroach (‚≠ê31k) - Scalable, Geo-Replicated, Transactional Datastore.
  • Coffer (‚≠ê40) - Simple ACID key-value database that supports transactions.
  • column (‚≠ê1.5k) - High-performance, columnar, embeddable in-memory store with bitmap indexing and transactions.
  • CovenantSQL (‚≠ê1.5k) - CovenantSQL is a SQL database on blockchain.
  • Databunker (‚≠ê1.3k) - Personally identifiable information (PII) storage service built to comply with GDPR and CCPA.
  • dgraph (‚≠ê21k) - Scalable, Distributed, Low Latency, High Throughput Graph Database.
  • diskv (‚≠ê1.4k) - Home-grown disk-backed key-value store.
  • eliasdb (‚≠ê1k) - Dependency-free, transactional graph database with REST API, phrase search and SQL-like query language.
  • godis (‚≠ê3.7k) - A Golang implemented high-performance Redis server and cluster.
  • goleveldb (‚≠ê6.3k) - Implementation of the LevelDB (‚≠ê38k) key/value database in Go.
  • hare (‚≠ê97) - A simple database management system that stores each table as a text file of line-delimited JSON.

  • ants (‚≠ê14k) - A high-performance and low-cost goroutine pool in Go.

  • gohive (‚≠ê53) - A highly performant and easy to use Goroutine pool for Go.
  • gollback (‚≠ê124) - asynchronous simple function utilities, for managing execution of closures and callbacks.
